Cell.Data: Entry
Category
Category
Question
Answer
New Customer
Features and Functionality
Standard & Datacenter
Are the features different between Windows Server 2012 Standard and Datacenter?
No, they have the same features. The editions only differ in their virtualization rights. Refer to the Product Website, or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video for additional information.
Essentials
What are the features and functionality of Windows Server 2012 Essentials?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials is a cloud connected, first server with unique capabilities designed for the needs of small businesses. Refer to the Product Website for additional information.
Licensing Information
Standard & Datacenter
How are the new Windows Server 2012 Standard and Datacenter editions licensed?

Both Standard and Datacenter editions are licensed following a Processor + CAL model. Each license covers up to two physical processors on a single server. Each user or device that accesses the server(s) will require a CAL.

For additional details, review the Product Use Rights or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video.
What are the Downgrade Rights for the Windows Server 2012 Standard and Datacenter editions?

Windows Server 2012 Standard can downgrade to earlier versions of Enterprise, Standard or Essentials editions. Windows Server 2012 Datacenter can downgrade to earlier versions of Datacenter, Enterprise, Standard and Essentials editions.

Refer to the Product Use Rights for further information.
What are the virtualization rights in Windows Server 2012 Standard and Datacenter editions?
A Windows Server 2012 Standard edition license will entitle you to run up to two virtual instances, and a Datacenter edition license will entitle you to run an unlimited number of virtual instances.
Where can I learn more about the Software Assurance benefits for Windows Server Standard and Datacenter editions?
You can learn more about available Software Assurance benefits in the Product List and Product Licensing Page.
Essentials
How is Windows Server 2012 Essentials licensed? Do you require CALs to access Windows Server 2012 Essentials?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials is a server license. It does not require CALs and supports up to 25 users. For additional details, review the Product Use Rights.
What are the Downgrade Rights for Windows Server 2012 Essentials edition?
Customers can downgrade to Small Business Server Essentials 2011. Refer to the Product Use Rights for further information.
What are the virtualization rights of Windows Server 2012 Essentials edition?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials can run as a guest in a virtual machine, but cannot be used as a host.
Where can I learn more about the Software Assurance benefits for Windows Server Essentials edition?
You can learn more about the available Software Assurance benefits in the Product List and Product Use Rights pages.
How To Buy and Pricing
Pricing
What is the pricing for Windows Server 2012, and how do I purchase it?
Contact your Microsoft partner, local reseller or your regional Microsoft customer support center.
Part Numbers
What are the part numbers for the different Windows Server 2012 editions?
Part numbers can be provided by authorized resellers. An authorized reseller can be found via Microsoft Pinpoint.
Install and Activation
Install
Where can I find assistance with installing Windows Server 2012?
Please Refer to TechNet for further assistance with Windows Server 2012 installation.
Where can I find assistance with deployment planning?

Online resources are available via TechNet. Software Assurance customers can go to the Volume Licensing Service Center to verify and learn more about deployment planning and Software Assurance benefits.
Fulfillment
If I am a Volume Licensing customer, can I download Windows Server 2012?
Yes, all Volume Licensing customers can download Windows Server 2012 via the Volume Licensing Service Center.
Product Keys
Where do I obtain product keys?

You can obtain your product keys through the Volume Licensing Service Center or the Microsoft Volume License Key department (888-352-7140). For software obtained outside of Microsoft Volume Licensing, product keys will come with the software.
Where do I obtain replacement key(s) if I lost my key or it doesn't work?

For Volume License customers, replacement product keys can be obtained via the Microsoft Volume Licensing Service Center or the Microsoft Volume License Activation Center (888-352-7140). For software obtained outside of Microsoft Volume Licensing, replacement product keys can be obtained through the original source or technical support.
Activation
How do I activate?

When acquired through Volume Licensing, Windows Server 2012 can be activated through Key Management Service (KMS), Active Directory-based activation, or Multiple Activation Key (MAK) activation.

For more information, please refer to the Activation Page.
System Requirements
What are the system requirements?
Refer to TechNet for more information.
Existing Customer
Features and Functionality
Standard & Datacenter
Are the features different between Windows Server 2012 Standard and Datacenter?

No, they have the same features. The only difference between the editions are the virtualization rights. Refer to the Product Website, or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video for additional information.
Essentials
What are the features and functionality of Windows Server 2012 Essentials?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials is a cloud connected, first server with unique capabilities designed for the needs of small businesses. Refer to the Product Website for additional information.
Licensing Information
Standard & Datacenter
How are the new Windows Server 2012 Editions licensed?

Both Standard and Datacenter editions are licensed following a Processor + CAL model. Each license covers up to two physical processors on a single server. Each user or device that accesses the server(s) will require a CAL.

For additional details, review the Product Use Rights, or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video.
What are the Downgrade Rights for each Windows Server 2012 edition?

Windows Server 2012 Standard can downgrade to earlier versions of Enterprise, Standard or Essentials editions. Windows Server 2012 Datacenter can downgrade to earlier versions of Datacenter, Enterprise, Standard and Essentials editions. Refer to the Product Use Rights for further information.
What are the virtualization rights in Windows Server 2012?
A Windows Server 2012 Standard edition license will entitle you to run up to two virtual instances, and a Datacenter edition license will entitle you to run an unlimited number of virtual instances.
Essentials
How is Windows Server 2012 Essentials licensed? Do you require CALs to access Windows Server 2012 Essentials?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials is a server license. It does not require CALs and supports up to 25 users. For additional details, review the Product Use Rights.
What are the Downgrade Rights for Windows Server 2012 Essentials edition?
Customers can downgrade to Small Business Server Essentials 2011. Refer to the Product Use Rights for further information.
What are the virtualization rights of Windows Server 2012 Essentials edition?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials can run as a guest in a virtual machine, but cannot be used as a host.
Where can I learn more about the Software Assurance benefits for Windows Server Essentials edition?
You can learn more about available Software Assurance benefits in the Product List and Product Use Rights.
Pricing, Part Numbers and Download
Pricing
What is the pricing for Windows Server 2012, and how do I purchase it?
Contact your Microsoft partner, local reseller or your regional Microsoft customer support center.
Part Numbers
What are the part numbers for the different Windows Server 2012 editions?
Part numbers can be provided by authorized resellers. An authorized reseller can be found via Microsoft Pinpoint.
How to Download
Where do I download my products?
All Volume Licensing customers can download Windows Server 2012 via the Volume Licensing Service Center.
Software Assurance and Migrations
Software Assurance Benefits
Where can I learn more about the Software Assurance benefits for Windows Servers?
You can learn more about the available Software Assurance benefits in the Product List and Product Use Rights.
New Version Rights
What are the migration rights for each edition?
Customers with active Software Assurance are eligible to upgrade to Windows Server 2012. New Version Rights and license grants are specified in the Product List.
What are the migration rights for CALs?
Customers with Software Assurance on Windows Server Client Access Licenses (CAL) migrate to Windows Server 2012 CALs. New Version Rights and license grants are specified in the Product List.
Step-Ups
Can I step-up my lower edition licenses to a higher edition license?
Customers may migrate from a lower level edition to a higher level edition of certain products with a Software Assurance Step-Up License as specified in the Product List.
Installation, Upgrades and Activations
Product Keys
Where do I obtain product keys?

You can obtain your product keys through the Volume Licensing Service Center or the Microsoft Volume License Key department (888-352-7140). For software obtained outside of Microsoft Volume Licensing, product keys will come with the software.
Where do I obtain replacement key(s) if I lost my key or it doesn't work?

For Volume License customers, replacement product keys can be obtained via the Microsoft Volume Licensing Service Center or the Microsoft Volume License Activation Center (888-352-7140). For software obtained outside of Microsoft Volume Licensing, replacement product keys can be obtained through the original source or technical support.
Activation
How do I activate?

When acquired through Volume Licensing, Windows Server 2012 can be activated through Key Management Service (KMS), Active Directory-based activation, or Multiple Activation Key (MAK) activation.

For more information, please refer to the Activation Page.
Upgrades
Where can I find out more information about upgrade installations?
For information about upgrade installations, please refer to TechNet.
Can I purchase an upgrade from one edition to another?
Customers may migrate from a lower level edition to a higher level edition of certain products with a Software Assurance Step-Up License as specified in the Product List.
Can I convert an evaluation edition of Windows Server 2012 to a full version?
Yes, when the license key is installed, the full functionality will be unlocked.
Installation
Where can I find assistance with installing Windows Server 2012?
Please Refer to TechNet for further assistance with Windows Server 2012 installation.
Where can I find assistance with deployment planning?

Online resources are available via TechNet. Software Assurance customers can work with the Volume Licensing Service Center to verify and learn more about deployment planning and Software Assurance benefits.
Editions
Datacenter
Licensing
How is Windows Server 2012 Datacenter edition licensed?

Datacenter edition is licensed following a Processor + CAL model. Each license covers up to two physical processors on a single server. Each user or device that accesses the server(s) will require a CAL.

For additional details, review the Product Use Rights, or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video.
How do I license users or devices that access Windows Server 2012 Datacenter edition?

Windows Server 2012 Datacenter edition maintains the Windows Server CAL requirement for every user or device accessing a server.

Some additional or advanced functionality requires the purchase of an additive CAL. These are CALs that you need in addition to the Windows Server CAL to access functionality, such as Remote Desktop Services or Active Directory Rights Management Services.

Please refer to the Product Use Rights document for further details.
How do I determine the most effective licensing for my environment?
Refer to the Microsoft Licensing Advisor or Product Use Rights, or contact your local Customer Service Group.
Functionality
What is the feature differentiation between Windows Server 2012 Datacenter and Standard editions?

Windows Server 2012 Datacenter and Standard editions have the same features. The only difference between the editions are the virtualization rights.

Refer to the Product Website, or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video for additional information.
Standard
Licensing

Windows Server 2012 Standard edition is licensed following a Processor + CAL model. Each license covers up to two physical processors on a single server. Each user or device that accesses the server(s) will require a CAL.

For additional details, review the Product Use Rights, or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video.
How do I license users or devices that access Windows Server 2012 Standard edition?

Windows Server 2012 Standard edition maintains the Windows Server CAL requirement for every user or device accessing a server. Some additional or advanced functionality requires the purchase of an additive CAL. These are CALs that you need in addition to the Windows Server CAL to access functionality, such as Remote Desktop Services or Active Directory Rights Management Services.

Please refer to the Product Use Rights document for further details.
How do I determine the most effective licensing for my environment?
Refer to the Licensing Advisor or Product Use Rights, or contact your local Customer Service Group.
Functionality

Windows Server 2012 Datacenter and Standard editions have the same features, the only difference between the editions are the virtualization rights. Refer to the Product Website, or the Windows Server 2012 Licensing video for additional information.
Essentials
Licensing
How is Windows Server 2012 Essentials licensed? Do you require CALs to access Windows Server 2012 Essentials?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials is a server license. It does not require CALs and supports up to 25 users. For additional details, review the Product Use Rights.
How do I license users or devices that access Windows Server 2012 Essentials edition?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials does not require Client Access Licenses (CALs). It supports up to 25 users.
Functionality
What are the features and functionality of Windows Server 2012 Essentials?
Windows Server 2012 Essentials is a cloud connected, first server with unique capabilities designed for the needs of small businesses. Refer to the Product Website for additional information.
Foundation
Licensing
How is Windows Server 2012 Foundation licensed?
Windows Server 2012 Foundation is a server license. It does not require CALs and supports up to 15 users. For additional details, review the Product Use Rights.
How do I license users or devices that access Windows Server 2012 Foundation edition?
Windows Server 2012 Foundation does not require Client Access Licenses (CALs). It supports up to 15 users.
Functionality
What functionality does Windows Server 2012 Foundation provide?
Windows Server 2012 Foundation is an entry level cost-effective server. Refer to the Product Website for additional information.
